1.text: Now about the collection for the saints, you are to do as I directed the churches of Galatia:

2.text: On the first day of every week, each of you should set aside a portion of his income, saving it up, so that when I come no collections will be needed.

3.text: Then, on my arrival, I will send letters with those you recommend to carry your gift to Jerusalem.

4.text: And if it is advisable for me to go also, they can travel with me.

5.text: After I go through Macedonia, however, I will come to you; for I will be going through Macedonia.

6.text: Perhaps I will stay with you awhile, or even spend the winter, so that you can help me on my journey, wherever I go.

7.text: For I do not want to see you now only in passing; I hope to spend some time with you, if the Lord permits.

8.text: But I will stay in Ephesus until Pentecost,

9.text: because a great door for effective work has opened to me, even though many oppose me.

10.text: If Timothy comes, see to it that he has nothing to fear while he is with you, for he is doing the work of the Lord, just as I am.

11.text: No one, then, should treat him with contempt. Send him on his way in peace so that he can return to me, for I am expecting him along with the brothers.

12.text: Now about our brother Apollos: I strongly urged him to go to you with the brothers. He was not at all inclined to go now, but he will go when he has the opportunity.

13.text: Be on the alert. Stand firm in the faith. Be men of courage. Be strong.

15.text: You know that Stephanas and his household were the first converts in Achaia, and they have devoted themselves to the service of the saints. Now I urge you, brothers,

16.text: to submit to such as these, and to every fellow worker and laborer.

17.text: I am glad that Stephanas, Fortunatus, and Achaicus have arrived, because they have supplied what was lacking from you.

18.text: For they refreshed my spirit and yours as well. Show your appreciation, therefore, to such men.

19.text: The churches in the province of Asia send you greetings. Aquila and Prisca greet you warmly in the Lord, and so does the church that meets at their house.

20.text: All the brothers here send you greetings. Greet one another with a holy kiss.

21.text: This greeting is in my own handâ€”Paul.

22.text: If anyone does not love the Lord, let him be under a curse. Come, O Lord!

23.text: The grace of the Lord Jesus be with you.

24.text: My love be with all of you in Christ Jesus. Amen.
